chunks.original_latin:
DIPLOMA II,
Quo Sigibertus dona confert monasteriis Stabulensi et
Malmundariensi  (ann. 651).
chunks.cleaned_english_translation: Diploma Two where Sigibert grants gifts to the monasteries of Stavelot and Malmedy, in the year 651.

Sigibert, king of the Franks, a distinguished man, addressing Count Godegisel. We recognize that by sharing our wealth with the holy Church, through our own will and with God's help, we enhance the prosperity of our kingdom. Royal power truly strengthens its own greatness when it generously bestows gifts in honor of God.

Thus, to the holy and venerable monasteries of Stavelot and Malmedy, where the respected Remaclus, bishop, and abbot, leads under Christ's guidance: These were built by the esteemed Grimoald, the mayor of the palace, in honor of the holy Mother of God, Mary, the apostles Peter and Paul, Saint John the Baptist, Saint Martin, and others, in the vast wilderness of the Ardennes. We have allowed these places to be established from our forest as per our command. Even though these monasteries have been enriched by Christ's grace, they possess little worldly wealth. Thus, inspired by divine guidance, we have decided to support these monasteries with a portion of our treasury.

Therefore, the tolls at the harbor of Vetraria, on the rivers Taunus and Itaque, along with the harbor called Sellis, and Vagatio on the river Loire, which were previously collected by our judges or agents from maritime transport or merchant trade, will now be granted to the aforementioned monasteries. This includes the people residing in, guarding, or managing those ports, for the stability of our kingdom, as a generous gift to the monks residing there.
chunks.original_latin:
Sigipertus, rex Francorum, vir inluster, Godegiselo
 comiti. Singulariter regni nostri
compendiis et prolixa felicitate, Deo adjuvante, confitemur
augmentare quicquid sacrosanctae Ecclesiae
propriae deliberationis arbitrio serenitas nostra contulerit;
quia tunc regalis potestas sui culminis fundamenta
corroborat, quando larga humanitate condigna
munera in honore Dei conferre non dubitat. Igitur sancta ac venerabilia monasteria, Stabulaus
sive Malmundarium cognominata, ubi vir venerabilis
Remaclus, episcopus et abba , Christo auspice,
 praeesse videtur: quae vir inluster Grimoaldus majordomus,
in honorem sanctae Dei genitricis Mariae,
sanctorumque apostolorum Petri et Pauli, sanctique
Joannis Baptistae, vel sancti Martini, seu ceterorum,
suo opere, in vasta eremi 
Arduennensis construxit, quemadmodum nos
loca ipsa ad ipsa monasteria aedificanda pro nostra
praeceptione ex foresta nostra concessimus: quae,
licet gratia Christi sint ditata praefata monasteria,
mundanae tamen substantiae cernuntur parumper
habere. Ideo divina inspiratione commoniti, decrevimus
aliquantulum de fisco nostro ad ipsa monasteria
conspicere et consolari. Telonium igitur
quod ad portum Vetraria, super fluvios Taunuco Ittaque,
et portum illum qui dicitur Sellis, immoque et
 Vagatio  super fluvium Ligeris,
quod judices vel agentes nostri ad portus ipsos tam
quod navalis evectio conferebat, aut 
undique negotiantum commercia in theloneo aut
quolibet ripatico ex ipsis portubus superius nominatis
in fisco nostro solebant recipere, pariter et homines
 qui in ipsis portubus commanent, vel ipsos
portus custodiunt, aut ibi aspicere videntur, pro stabilitate
regni nostri, ad monasteria superius nominata,
vel monachis ibidem consistentibus, nostri muneris
largitate concedimus.

chunks.cleaned_english_translation:
Therefore, we have issued this decree to ensure that neither you, nor your juniors or successors, nor anyone involved with the monasteries, ever dares to act against it.

Instead, the tolls from the mentioned ports, which our treasury once expected, are now granted for the lighting of the basilicas or the stipends of the monks who diligently perform their daily duties there, so they may continually thrive and grow.

If anyone transfers these ports to their lands, making it easier to withhold the toll meant for our treasury, we order that ships should use the ports where they traditionally went during our royal predecessors' times; and tolls should not be collected from you, your juniors, or successors elsewhere.

If, in earlier years, when we appeared youthful, anyone accepted anything from this concession document, it should be nullified and void, as it was agreed otherwise with many of our loyal subjects.

With the Lord's help, when we reach the rightful age for the kingdom, those concessions granted by our authority from our original treasury should remain stable in God's name during the 14th year of our reign.

We have also reinforced this authority with our handwritten endorsements, so it may remain intact now and in the future.
chunks.original_latin:
Quapropter praesenti ex hac
jussimus promulgari praeceptione, ut neque vos,
neque juniores aut successores vestri, aut quislibet
quae ad partem monasteriorum ex hoc pertinet, nunquam
 praesumatis existere contrarii;
sed magis theloneos ipsos de portubus superius nominatis,
quandocumque exinde fiscus noster poterat
sperare, in luminaribus, jam dictis basilicis vel stipendiis
monachorum qui ibidem cursum regulariter
quotidianis horis implent, annuimus possidendos,
ut omni tempore proficiant in augmento . Et si
forte aliqui portus ipsos praenominatos pro terris
ipsorum propriis transtulerint, quo facilius ipsum
theloneum quemadmodum ad fiscum nostrum debuerat
provenire , subtraxerint, jubemus
ut navigia ad portus ipsos, ubi per tempora
praecedentium regum parentum nostrorum ire consuetudinem
habuerant, discurrant; et alibi theloneus
neque a vobis, neque a junioribus seu successoribus
vestris exigatur. Quod fiat, ut, si ante superiores
annos, dummodo sub tenera adhuc videbamur aetate
subsistere, aliquis quodlibet ex hujus cessione instrumenti
 accepit,
nullus mancipetur effectus, sed vacuum et inane permaneat,
dum et aliter compluribus fidelibus nostris
 noscitur esse conventum, ut dum, auxiliante Domino,
in regnum ad legitimam pervenimus aetatem, cessiones
illius, quae ex originario fisco nostro aliquid serenitas
nostra concesserat, deinceps inantea, hoc
est, anno  XIV regni nostri  debeant
in Dei nomine stabiles esse. Hanc quoque
 auctoritatem, ut in omnibus valitura, in nostris et
futuris temporibus valitura intacta valeat durare , manus nostrae
subscriptionibus  roboravimus.
